abstract: A jury ruled that Pfizer violated laws protecting free speech and whistle-blowers by retaliating against a worker who said she was sickened by a genetically engineered virus at the company.
snippet: A jury ruled that Pfizer violated laws protecting free speech and whistle-blowers by retaliating against a worker who said she was sickened by a genetically engineered virus at the company.
lead_paragraph: A federal jury has awarded $1.37 million in damages to a former Pfizer scientist who claimed she was sickened by a genetically engineered virus at a company laboratory and then fired for raising safety concerns.

headline.main: A Pfizer Whistle-Blower Is Awarded $1.4 Million
headline.print_headline: A Pfizer Whistle-Blower Is Awarded $1.4 Million

byline.original: By Andrew Pollack and Duff Wilson
